title: Bug 37021 - Source path wrong in declare warning on binary files
description: Bug 37021 - Source path wrong in declare warning on binary files. When targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main'. I have also observed cases where the filenames do not appear at all in the declare warning messages. The problem can be reproduced by running the code provided in tests/new/binaryWarnings/. It is important to note that these tests can sometimes yield false positives due to the lack of filename checking in harness verification of messages. This issue was initially noticed in AJDT, where the filename is sometimes omitted if it doesn't make sense to AJDT.
OB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' rather than 'app/Main'. I have also observed cases where the filenames do not appear at all in the declare warning messages.
EB: The source path should be listed in the form 'app/Main' when targeting .class files from injars. The declare warning messages should always display the filenames.
SR: To reproduce the issue, run the code provided in tests/new/binaryWarnings/. Check the declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars and verify that the source path is shown in the form 'app.Main.class' and not 'app/Main'. Also, confirm that the filenames are displayed correctly in the declare warning messages.
